summary: This is an email exchange between defense attorney Michael Bachner and federal prosecutors regarding a client's intention to invoke the Fifth Amendment before a grand jury investigating Jeffrey Epstein. The email includes attachments of the Epstein non-prosecution agreement and a proffer agreement.

persons.name: Michael Bachner
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is a potential witness in the Epstein investigation; notifies prosecutors that his client will invoke Fifth Amendment privilege before the grand jury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation referenced in the email correspondence is about Jeffrey Epstein; his non-prosecution agreement from 2007 is attached to the email.

connections.description: Bachner is representing a client involved in the Epstein investigation, indicating a legal connection to the case.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: A witness represented by Michael Bachner was subpoenaed to testify before a grand jury investigating Epstein on this date.

events.title: Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement Signed
events.description: The non-prosecution agreement (NPA) for Jeffrey Epstein was executed, which is attached to the email correspondence.

keyFacts: A witness represented by attorney Michael Bachner intended to invoke the Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination if called to testify before the Epstein grand jury on July 24, 2019.
The email correspondence includes attachments of Jeffrey Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement and a blank proffer agreement.
The communication is between defense counsel and federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York regarding the Epstein investigation.
The email highlights ongoing grand jury proceedings in the Epstein case in July 2019, shortly before Epstein's arrest.
